abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Livestock Sector
            Rehabilitation Project for Guinea was satisfactory. The
            project achieved its objectives, its impact on institutional
            development has been substantial, sustainability is likely,
            and the performance of both the Bank and Borrower was
            satisfactory. Several lessons can be learned from this
            project. First, an appropriate macroeconomic framework is
            essential to achieving success. Second, sound project
            identification and preparation are helpful in recognizing
            the major difficulties likely to be encountered during
            implementation. Third, the frequency and regularity of
            supervision missions and their composition of technical
            specialists and representatives of co-financiers contributed
            significantly to successful project implementation. Fourth,
            a full and frank dialogue between the Bank and Government
            was constructive and helpful in obtaining a successful
            project outcome. Fifth, training can play a key role in
            upgrading skills. Sixth, the mid-term review can be very
            helpful in making midcourse changes during implementation to
            reorient some project components. Finally, the timely
            availability of counterpart funding will require particular
            attention in the future.
